parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dry stalk, chip of wood, twig, splinter, chaff. From karpho; a dry twig or straw.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To take note of, perceive, consider carefully, discern, detect, make account of. From kata and noieo; to observe fully.
A beam or spar of timber. From dechomai; a stick of timber.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
